list.name: Changes
list.comment: Loading and saving works both in MySQL and JSONs.w

task.summary: Default task
Changes in metadata scheme, introduction of entity manager. Can't make it work because of import problems ... so untested
Change import statements to correct and working form
metadata entity types registration in the EntityManager works,
Change the file structure of the project so the resource type related classes are in a separate files in "resource_managers" directory to allow for modularity
working re-implementation fo the file downloading and unzipping functions to FileSystemDataset, minor changes to metadata scheme

first implementation of storing&loading the search strings for entity types from MySQL database - it works when there's MySQL server running on "localhost" (whichever computer it is as long as the python interpreter is on the same machine)
adujstments to the search patterns loading in EntityManager first code in filesystem crawler (not tested, not working)

more adjustments in search patterns loading: the database split into separate DBs for search patterns and keywords so the keywords may be translated before search. Each of the resource type need to have its own keywords DB to be able to search correctly.

Restructure the resource management classes to allow for multi-type datasets (the Container is now type-specific and Dataset is universal). The DatasetHandler and DatasetHandlerFactory replaced by ContainerHandler and ContainerHandlerFactory. Split keywords loading for Container type-specific databases to allow modularity (still not working though). Search patterns loading works.
Further adjustments in the resurce management structure
Comments for the webapp
ResourceManagement loading work in prograss. Structure main.py as a frontend workflow simulation
More MetadataEntity subclesses added ... working on clearing up the BonaRes scheme transfer
Working loading files from json from Zenodo, unpacking zip, recognizing all the files (downloaded and unzipped) into containers tree
Methods docstrings and comments added
Minor changes in ResourceManager, metadata_scheme.py and FileSystemContainer.showContents()
Working modular Publisher approach. New publisher can be added by adding subclass in data_publishers.py
Working modular Publisher approach. New publisher can be added by adding subclass in data_publishers.py
new JSON container introduced and used for storing DOI record metadata (and will be used for storing any JSON data)
more fun with the JSON container (method for inner structure printing - will be used as a template for different processing) adjustements to showContents method of containerHandler

more adjustments of the 'json' container
getMetadataFromPublisher method removed from ResourceManagement as it is now method of the Publisher class
adjustments to the management of file content json structure recognizing working properly ValueNotInDomainError exception added
more adjustments to the scheme
Separate loading file information from publisher and downloading the files Create new Dataset through ResourceManager, add containers from RM to Dataset
First shot on treating the downloaded zip file name so it's not an incorrect dirname

Source files management changed - SourceFile class introduced to hold information about the original downloaded/uploaded file (for better management of the temporary files storage)
First working crawling for CSV files - the file is read, individual tables are delineated and processed separately: the headers are recognized and the table is converted into pandas daraframe

The FileSystemCrawlerFactory tries for 'txt' files the 'csv' crawler first and if it gains any tables (meaning that it went through all the 'filters' of detect_delimiters() and creating the dataframe) the csv Crawler is assigned to the txt file - the container has 'csv' Crawler eventhough it's a 'txt' file

backbone of saving of ResourceManager works, when new ResourceManager is created it gets a record in DB established, assigned ID is used for naming the directory where the resource's files are stored. Resource's name must be unique within one user's resources otherwise a DatabaseEntryError exception is thrown

file management of ResourceManager extended: all files are deleted on ResourceManager instance destruction if files can't be kept. further development of saving and updating the ResourceManager in database

Container ID assignment repaired (IDs are unique again). File extension processing improved to correctly handle filenames starting with dot and no extension (like '.gitignore') ResourceManager reference and parent container reference added to all containers. ResourceManager name duplicity check added on DB record update.
Basic saving added for container structure. DB access logic for saving, updating (and future loading) moved to db_access.py
Repair error where container paths were not stored in DB, change data type for path column i DB

Refactor 'ResourceManager' to 'ProjectManager' with all related appearances in the code and the database. ProjectManager (former ResourceManager) no longer a singleton - more projects can be active (opened) at once Save Dataset. Loading of Project and Containers pushed a little further.
'Use case' functions created to easily execute a series of commands mimicking a common sequence of actions
Loading and saving of project and its datasets and container structure works! The in-memory container tree is reconstructed after loading from DB.
Saving of ContainerHandler subclasses' attributes generalized - subclass specific attributes are obtained from instance attribute 'serializationDict'
Minor changes in string formating and comments

All operations with file paths changed to relative ... uff
And some additional minor adjustment to DB saving
projects.keep_files default value assigned to 1
trying to make loading work with files being deleted after previous session
pro-forma commit of the databases
(re)assign DOI to Project instance on load from DB Correction of None relative path handling on load from DB
More adjustments to saving and loading of containers. DOI and publisher metadata JSONs are saved as file to Project.temp_dir as soon as they're obtained in the setDOI() method

Adjustment to downloaded files management - not to delete ALL files when deleting a Project instance with .keepFiles=False but only the downloaded files - generated files (like the DOI and publisher metadata) will not be deleted

More development and mistakes correction in project loadig and saving. Saving and loading made modular to allow for alternative ways of saving the project structure. NullConnector introduced as alternative for MySQL database - not everything solved yet though (containers structure and datasets not saved yet)

More development and mistakes correction in project loadig and saving. Saving and loading made modular to allow for alternative ways of saving the project structure. NullConnector introduced as alternative for MySQL database - not everything solved yet though (containers structure and datasets not saved yet)
Saving containers structure to JSON by NullConnector works ... loading not yet, MySQLConnector needs to be updated accordingly
Saving containers to MySQL and filesystem works now. some minor adjustments regarding creating the projects directories. NullConnector loading containers from json still not implemented
Loading and saving works both in MySQL and JSONs.w

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
